fchen

Class PrivatePrefixBasedOutsourcing

  • java.lang.Object
    • fchen.PrivatePrefixBasedOutsourcing

  • public class PrivatePrefixBasedOutsourcing
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements the prefix-based scheme for verifiable file outsorucing with filename privacy protection. The basic idea is to separate all possible filenames into two sets: one includes all existing filenames; the other contains all other possible filenames using wildcard representation of strings. Note that all these filenames are contained in one data structure. When the client queires a file, he can send the MACs of all possible filenames to the cloud for search, instead of all clear filenames.
    Author:
    Chen, Fei, Department of Computer Science and Engineering, The Chinese University of Hong Kong., Email: chenfeiorange@163.com, Webpage: https://sites.google.com/site/chenfeiorange/, Last Updating Date: 2013.04.17

    • Field Detail

      • SPECIAL_PREVIOUS

        public static final java.lang.String SPECIAL_PREVIOUS
        SPECIAL_PREVIOUS = "@"; It is a special symbol, denoting that a queried filename is a prefix of some existing file. SPECIAL_AFTER = "#"; It is a special symbol, denoting that a queried filename is different from all existing files. Note that "#" lies behind the first place where the queried filename is different.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SPECIAL_AFTER

        public static final java.lang.String SPECIAL_AFTER
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • PrivatePrefixBasedOutsourcing

        public PrivatePrefixBasedOutsourcing(java.lang.String rootDirectory)
        It constructs an object dealing with all files in a directory. Initialization work is also done, including setting up the HMAC-SHA256 parameters. The key for the MAC algorithm is fixed in the class. You can also change it by modifying the source codes. Also note that two different keys are used; one for the filename protection, the other for preventing possible cheats from the cloud.
        Parameters:
        rootDirectory - The directory for all the files to be outsourced.

    • Method Detail

      • print

        public void print()
        It prints out the information about all possible filenames and their MACs.

      • outsource

        public void outsource()
        It helps the client outsource all possible files to the cloud, including both the filenames and their MACs. The original filename is MACed; thus, the cloud cannot figure out the real filename.

      • query

        public java.lang.String[] query(java.lang.String filename)
        It helps the client send a query to the cloud.
        Parameters:
        filename - The file to be queried.
        Returns:
        A string array storing all possible filenames in a MACed way.

      • search

        public ProofData search(java.lang.String[] filename)
        It helps the cloud search the filenames which are queried by the client.
        Parameters:
        filename - The file to be queried.
        Returns:
        A proof data object containing the verification information.
        See Also:
        ProofData

      • verify

        public int verify(java.lang.String filename,
         ProofData proof)
        It helps a client verify whether the returned result from the cloud is correct.
        Parameters:
        filename - The queried file.
        proof - The proof that the cloud returns.
        Returns:
        An integer indicating whether search is successful and whether the cloud cheats. '0' denotes search failure; '1' denotes a verifiable search; '2' denotes the cloud cheats.

      • getRandomFile

        public java.lang.String getRandomFile()
        It generates a random filename. This function is mainly for performance evaluation purpose.
        Returns:
        A random existing filename.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The hexadecimal string.
